original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Sep 17 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Sep 18 07]
I am seeing this critically ill woman for management of respiratory insufficiency and atrial fibrillation .
I have examined the patient , reviewed the laboratory data , chest x-ray film , and events of the evening .
She underwent pulmonic valve repair yesterday , went back to the OR for bleeding after multiple units of blood were given .
Bleeding was terminated in the OR .
She has done well .
From a respiratory standpoint , she has bilateral infiltrates still , but her Aa gradient is reasonable and has come down to 40% , 5 of PEEP , and she looks fairly comfortable on CPAP .
She has a PO2 of 111 .
She is only positive of about a liter at this point , given good urinary input as well as the bleeding that she had .
I would favor giving her a trial of extubation .
She has an ASD repair .
Will start her ultimately on some aspirin .
She had some rapid atrial fibrillation last evening .
She has been on Cardizem , and I have asked to wean that off .
She is currently in a sinus rhythm .
She is warm and well perfused .
Continue with GI prophylaxis .
Keep the chest tubes in place at this point .
T = 30
__________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Sep 18 2007] 19:21:35
T :
**DATE[Sep 18 2007] 20:59:53
R :
**DATE[Sep 18 2007] 20:59:53/plb
Job ID :
352271/**ID-NUM
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[XXX , VVV M]. ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[WWW XXX]
**DATE[Oct 05 2007] 03:25:35 PM
